bill.summary: 2/3/1998--Introduced. Condemns: (1) the atrocities being carried out in Algeria; (2) the perpetrators of violence and other crimes against humanity and human rights violations in Algeria; and (3) those who are inciting violence. Urges: (1) all Algerians to cease recourse to violence; (2) the Algerian Government to take all necessary and lawful steps to prevent violence and to provide for the security, safety, and welfare of all its citizens; (3) the Algerian leadership to be more open and to cooperate with international inquiries; (4) the Algerian authorities to act more effectively to prevent violence from occurring and to stop it more speedily when it occurs; and (5) the United States to continue to call for national reconciliation and a more democratic course in Algeria and to encourage the Algiers regime to have a dialogue with all who renounce violence.
